title: Assemblies of God Schools
description:
Assemblies of God schools are Christian educational institutions affiliated with the Assemblies of God denomination, one of the largest Pentecostal denominations in the world.

Key characteristics of Assemblies of God schools:

• Strong emphasis on biblical authority and evangelical faith
• Belief in baptism of the Holy Spirit and spiritual gifts
• Dynamic worship and prayer integrated into school life
• Focus on missions and global awareness
• Character education based on Christian principles
• Often feature contemporary worship styles

The Assemblies of God operates a network of schools across the United States, with educational standards coordinated through denominational oversight.

These schools typically emphasize personal faith development, with opportunities for students to explore and express their spirituality through chapel services, prayer groups, and service projects.

When considering an Assemblies of God school, ask about their approach to spiritual formation, chapel expectations, and how they support students from various faith backgrounds.
